SENT.plain: We present a case of dissection of the extracranial vertebral artery with prominent occipital pain and elements of the lateral medullary syndrome
Arteriography showed a string and pearl sign
Magnetic resonance imaging allowed visualization of an intramural thrombus associated with a narrow vascular lumen
The distal portion of the diseased artery was ligated and vascular reconstruction using an interposed radial artery graft was performed
The diagnostic roles of angiography and magnetic resonance imaging, and therapeutic strategies are discussed
